result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Zehnder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Straight-Time.
-Sentence credit of 61 days is granted.
Concurrent with: to present sentence.

-Standard court costs and DNA Surcharge waived by court. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Detainer Lift to Redgranite Correctional Institution

Case called at 1:36 PM
Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Robert A Zehnder.  
Defendant Robert A Zehnder in court, in custody.  
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds the defendant Guilty.
State makes sentencing recommendations.  Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
75-days Jail straight time
61-days Credit time
Sentence is to run Concurrent to his present sentence.

Costs:  $243.00 (Waived by the Court)
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00 (Waived by the Court)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
